name: Lamb Feta Peppers
author: Taseia Armstrong
summary: Since I am Greek, I have learned many good Greek recipes over the years!  This is one of my favorites. It's a savory combination of lamb, rice and feta cheese stuffed into sweet green bell peppers and smothered with tomato sauce.
directions: Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C)
Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat, add onion and cook for four minutes until soft
Stir in garlic and cook one minute
Slice tops off peppers and remove seeds
Stand peppers upright in a a 9x12-inch baking dish
In large bowl, combine onion mixture, dill, salt, allspice and pepper
Mix in rice and lamb, fold in feta cheese
Mix tomato sauce with water, lemon juice and sugar
Pour half over peppers, and half over bottom of dish
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes
Uncover and continue baking 15 minutes, basing occasionally with sauce, until a meat thermometer inserted in center of filling reads 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
